items.name: PMCR
items.description: SBS product mode and configuration register.

items.name: CCCSR
items.description: SBS I/O compensation cell control and status register.

items.name: CCVALR
items.description: SBS compensation cell for I/Os value register.

items.name: CCSWVALR
items.description: SBS compensation cell for I/Os software value register.

fields.name: PVD_BL
fields.description: PVD break lock This bit is set by SW and cleared only by a system reset. it can be used to enable and lock the connection to TIM1/8/15/16/17Break input as well as the PVDE and PLS[2:0] bitfields in the PWR_CR1 register. Once set, this bit is cleared only by a system reset.

fields.name: FLASHECC_BL
fields.description: Flash ECC error break lock Set this bit to enable and lock the connection between embedded flash memory ECC double error detection flag and break inputs of TIM1/15/16/17 peripherals. Once set, this bit is cleared only by a system reset.

fields.name: CM7LCKUP_BL
fields.description: Cortex-M7 lockup break lock Set this bit to enable and lock the connection between the Cortex-M7 lockup (HardFault) output and break inputs of TIM1/15/16/17 peripherals. Once set, this bit is cleared only by a system reset.

fields.name: BKRAMECC_BL
fields.description: Backup RAM ECC error break lock Set this bit to enable and lock the connection between backup RAM ECC double error detection flag and break inputs of TIM1/15/16/17 peripherals. Once set, this bit is cleared only by a system reset.

fields.name: DTCMECC_BL
fields.description: DTCM ECC error break lock Set this bit to enable and lock the connection between DTCM ECC double error detection flag and break inputs of TIM1/15/16/17 peripherals. Once set, this bit is cleared only by a system reset. Note: The DTCM0 and DTCM1 are Ored to give DTCMECC.

fields.name: ITCMECC_BL
fields.description: ITCM ECC error break lock Set this bit to enable and lock the connection between ITCM ECC double error detection flag and break inputs of TIM1/15/16/17 peripherals. Once set, this bit is cleared only by a system reset.

fields.name: ARAM3ECC_BL
fields.description: AXIRAM3 ECC error break lock Set this bit to enable and lock the connection between AXIRAM3 ECC double error detection flag and break inputs of TIM1/15/16/17 peripherals. Once set this bit is cleared only by a system reset.

fields.name: ARAM1ECC_BL
fields.description: AXIRAM1 ECC error break lock Set this bit to enable and lock the connection between AXIRAM1 ECC double error detection flag and break inputs of TIM1/15/16/17 peripherals. Once set, this bit is cleared only by a system reset.

fields.name: INITVTOR
fields.description: initial vector for Cortex-M7 This register includes the physical boot address used by the Cortex-M7 after reset.

fieldset/CCCSR.description: SBS I/O compensation cell control and status register.

fields.name: COMP_EN
fields.description: Compensation cell enable Set this bit to enable the compensation cell.

fields.name: COMP_CODESEL
fields.description: Compensation cell code selection This bit selects the code to be applied for the I/O compensation cell.

fields.name: OCTO1_COMP_EN
fields.description: XSPIM_P1 compensation cell enable Set this bit to enable the XSPIM_P1 compensation cell.

fields.name: OCTO1_COMP_CODESEL
fields.description: XSPIM_P1 compensation cell code selection This bit selects the code to be applied for the XSPIM_P1 I/O compensation cell.

fields.name: OCTO2_COMP_EN
fields.description: XSPIM_P2 compensation cell enable Set this bit to enable the XSPIM_P2 compensation cell.

fields.name: OCTO2_COMP_CODESEL
fields.description: XSPIM_P2 compensation cell code selection This bit selects the code to be applied for the XSPIM_P2 I/O compensation cell.

fields.name: COMP_RDY
fields.description: Compensation cell ready This bit provides the status of the compensation cell.

fields.name: OCTO1_COMP_RDY
fields.description: XSPIM_P1 compensation cell ready This bit provides the status of the XSPIM_P1 compensation cell.

fields.name: OCTO2_COMP_RDY
fields.description: XSPIM_P2 compensation cell ready This bit provides the status of the XSPIM_P2 compensation cell.

fields.name: IOHSLV
fields.description: I/O high speed at low voltage When this bit is set, the speed of the I/Os is optimized when the device voltage is low. This bit is active only if VDDIO_HSLV user option bit is set in FLASH. It must be used only if the device supply voltage is below 2.7 V. Setting this bit when V<sub>DD</sub> is higher than 2.7 V may be destructive.

fields.name: OCTO1_IOHSLV
fields.description: XSPIM_P1 I/O high speed at low voltage When this bit is set, the speed of the XSPIM_P1 I/Os is optimized when the device voltage is low. This bit is active only if OCTO1_HSLV user option bit is set in FLASH. This bit must be used only if the device supply voltage is below 2.7 V. Setting this bit when V<sub>DD</sub> is higher than 2.7 V may be destructive.

fields.name: OCTO2_IOHSLV
fields.description: XSPIM_P2 I/O high speed at low voltage When this bit is set, the speed of the XSPIM_P2 I/Os is optimized when the device voltage is low. This bit is active only if OCTO2_HSLV user option bit is set in FLASH. This bit must be used only if the device supply voltage is below 2.7 V. Setting this bit when V<sub>DD</sub> is higher than 2.7 V may be destructive.

fieldset/CCSWVALR.description: SBS compensation cell for I/Os software value register.

fields.name: SW_NSRC
fields.description: Software NMOS transistors slew-rate compensation This bitfield returns the NMOS transistors slew-rate compensation value computed by the cell. It is interpreted to compensate the NMOS transistors slew rate in the functional range if COMP_CODESEL = 1 in SBS_CCCSR register.

fields.name: SW_PSRC
fields.description: Software PMOS transistors slew-rate compensation This bitfield returns the PMOS transistors slew-rate compensation value computed by the cell. It is interpreted to compensate the PMOS transistors slew rate in the functional range if COMP_CODESEL = 1 in SBS_CCCSR register.

fields.name: OCTO1_SW_NSRC
fields.description: XSPIM_P1 software NMOS transistors slew-rate compensation This bitfield returns the NMOS transistors slew -ate compensation value computed by the cell. It is interpreted by XSPIM_P1 to compensate the NMOS transistors slew rate in the functional range if OCTO1_COMP_CODESEL = 1 in SBS_CCCSR register.

fields.name: OCTO1_SW_PSRC
fields.description: XSPIM_P1 software PMOS transistors slew-rate compensation This bitfield returns the PMOS transistors slew-rate compensation value computed by the cell. It is interpreted by XSPIM_P1 to compensate the PMOS transistors slew rate in the functional range if OCTO1_COMP_CODESEL = 1 in SBS_CCCSR register.

fields.name: OCTO2_SW_NSRC
fields.description: XSPIM_P2 software NMOS transistors slew-rate compensation This bitfield returns the NMOS transistors slew-rate compensation value computed by the cell. It is interpreted by XSPIM_P2 to compensate the NMOS transistors slew rate in the functional range if OCTO2_COMP_CODESEL = 1 in SBS_CCCSR register.

fields.name: OCTO2_SW_PSRC
fields.description: XSPIM_P2 software PMOS transistors slew-rate compensation This bitfield returns the PMOS transistors slew-rate compensation value computed by the cell. It is interpreted by XSPIM_P2 to compensate the PMOS transistors slew rate in the functional range if OCTO2_COMP_CODESEL = 1 in SBS_CCCSR register.

fieldset/CCVALR.description: SBS compensation cell for I/Os value register.

fields.name: NSRC
fields.description: NMOS transistors slew-rate compensation This bitfield returns the NMOS transistors slew-rate compensation value computed by the cell. It is interpreted to compensate the NMOS transistors slew rate in the functional range if COMP_CODESEL = 0 in SBS_CCCSR register.

fields.name: PSRC
fields.description: PMOS transistors slew-rate compensation This bitfield returns the PMOS transistors slew-rate compensation value computed by the cell. It is interpreted to compensate the PMOS transistors slew rate in the functional range if COMP_CODESEL = 0 in SBS_CCCSR register.

fields.name: OCTO1_NSRC
fields.description: XSPIM_P1 NMOS transistors slew-rate compensation This bitfield returns the NMOS transistors slew-rate compensation value computed by the cell. It is interpreted by XSPIM_P1 to compensate the NMOS transistors slew rate in the functional range if OCTO1_COMP_CODESEL = 0 in SBS_CCCSR register.

fields.name: OCTO1_PSRC
fields.description: XSPIM_P1 PMOS transistors slew-rate compensation This bitfield returns the PMOS transistors slew-rate compensation value computed by the cell. It is interpreted by XSPIM_P1 to compensate the PMOS transistors slew rate in the functional range if OCTO1_COMP_CODESEL = 0 in SBS_CCCSR register.

fields.name: OCTO2_NSRC
fields.description: XSPIM_P2 NMOS transistors slew-rate compensation This bitfield returns the NMOS transistors slew-rate compensation value computed by the cell. It is interpreted by XSPIM_P2 to compensate the NMOS transistors slew rate in the functional range if OCTO2_COMP_CODESEL = 0 in SBS_CCCSR register.

fields.name: OCTO2_PSRC
fields.description: XSPIM_P2 PMOS transistors slew-rate compensation This bitfield returns the PMOS transistors slew-rate compensation value computed by the cell. It is interpreted by XSPIM_P2 to compensate the PMOS transistors slew rate in the functional range if OCTO2_COMP_CODESEL = 0 in SBS_CCCSR register.

fields.name: AP_UNLOCK
fields.description: access port unlock Write 0xB4 to this bitfield to open the device access port.

fields.name: DBG_UNLOCK
fields.description: debug unlock Write 0xB4 to this bitfield to open the debug when HDPL in SBS_HDPLSR equals to DBG_AUTH_HDPL in this register.

fields.name: DBG_AUTH_HDPL
fields.description: authenticated debug hide protection level Writing to this bitfield defines at which HDPL the authenticated debug opens. Note: Writing any other values is ignored. Reading any other value means the authenticated debug always fails.

fields.name: DBGCFG_LOCK
fields.description: debug configuration lock Reading this bitfield returns 0x6A if the bitfield value is different from 0xB4. Other: Writes to SBS_DBGCR ignored Note: 0xC3 is the recommended value to lock the debug configuration using this bitfield.

fields.name: EXTI
fields.description: EXTI x configuration (x = 4 to 7)

fields.name: FPU_IE
fields.description: FPU interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable the Cortex-M7 FPU interrupts xxxxx1: Invalid operation interrupt enabled (xxxxx0 to disable) xxxx1x: Divide-by-zero interrupt enabled (xxxx0x to disable) xxx1xx: Underflow interrupt enabled (xxx0xx to disable) xx1xxx: Overflow interrupt enabled (xx0xxx to disable) x1xxxx: Input denormal interrupt enabled (x0xxxx to disable) 1xxxxx: Inexact interrupt enabled (0xxxxx to disable), disabled by default.

fields.name: INCR_HDPL
fields.description: increment HDPL Write 0x6A to increment device HDPL by one. After a write, the register value reverts to its default value (0xB4).

fields.name: HDPL
fields.description: hide protection level This bitfield returns the current HDPL of the device. 0x6F and other codes: HDPL3, corresponding to non-boot application. Note: The device state (open/close) is defined in FLASH_NVSTATER register of the embedded Flash memory.

fields.name: MEF
fields.description: memory erase flag This bit is set by hardware when BKPRAM and PKA SRAM erase is ongoing after a POWER ON reset or one tamper event (see Section 50: Tamper and backup registers (TAMP) for details). This bit is cleared when the erase is done.

fieldset/PMCR.description: SBS product mode and configuration register.

fields.name: FMPLUS_PB6
fields.description: Fast-mode Plus on PB(6).

fields.name: FMPLUS_PB7
fields.description: Fast-mode Plus on PB(7).

fields.name: FMPLUS_PB8
fields.description: Fast-mode Plus on PB(8).

fields.name: FMPLUS_PB9
fields.description: Fast-mode Plus on PB(9).

fields.name: BOOSTEN
fields.description: booster enable Set this bit to reduce the THD of the analog switches when the supply voltage is below 2.7 V. guaranteeing the same performance as with the full voltage range. To avoid current consumption due to booster activation when V<sub>DDA</sub> < 2.7 V and V<sub>DD</sub> > 2.7 V, V<sub>DD</sub> can be selected as supply voltage for analog switches by setting BOOSTVDDSEL bit in SBS_PMCR. In this case, the BOOSTEN bit must be cleared to avoid unwanted power consumption.

fields.name: BOOSTVDDSEL
fields.description: booster V<sub>DD</sub> selection This bit selects the analog switch supply voltage, between V<sub>DD</sub>, V<sub>DDA</sub> and booster. To avoid current consumption due to booster activation when V<sub>DDA</sub> < 2.7 V and V<sub>DD</sub> > 2.7 V, V<sub>DD</sub> can be selected as supply voltage for analog switches. In this case, the BOOSTEN bit must be cleared to avoid unwanted power consumption. When both V<sub>DD and </sub>V<sub>DDA</sub> are below 2.7 V, the booster is still needed to obtain full AC performances from the I/O analog switches.

fields.name: ETH_SEL_PHY
fields.description: Ethernet PHY interface selection.

fields.name: AXIRAM_WS
fields.description: AXIRAM wait state Set this bit to add one wait state to all AXIRAMs when ECC = 0. When ECC = 1 there is one wait state by default.

fields.name: RSSCMD
fields.description: RSS command The application can use this bitfield to pass on a command to the RSS, executed at the next reset.

variants.name: Ws0
variants.description: No wait state added when accessing any AXIRAM with ECC = 0.

variants.name: Ws1
variants.description: One wait state added when accessing any AXIRAM with ECC = 0. In this case, Fmax = 500 MHz is not guaranteed. (TBC).

variants.name: HDPL0
variants.description: HDPL0, corresponding to ST-RSS (default when device is close).
